author: Christopher Alessi
title: Oil Edges Up on Hopes for OPEC Cut Extension
text:
LONDON—Oil prices ticked up Friday, retracing some losses from the previous day after fresh signs the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries could continue to hold back production into 2019.
Brent crude, the global benchmark, was up 0.1%, at $68.98 a barrel on London’s Intercontinental Exchange. On the New York Mercantile Exchange, West Texas Intermediate futures were up by 0.2%, at $64.43 a barrel.
